study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effectiveness of acupressure in decreasing pain and anxiety in athletes with acute musculoskeletal sports injuries.
results_summary: Acupressure reduced pain intensity by 11 mm compared to sham acupressure and 9 mm compared to no intervention, but it did not affect anxiety levels or secondary outcomes like satisfaction or willingness to repeat treatment.
population_specificity: Seventy-nine athletes with acute sport-related musculoskeletal injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the short-term effects of self-administered acupressure compared to sleep hygiene education for alleviating insomnia.
results_summary: Self-administered acupressure significantly reduced Insomnia Severity Index scores at week 8 compared to sleep hygiene education, though the difference did not remain significant after Bonferroni correction. Moderate effect sizes were observed for sleep onset latency and wake after sleep onset, but these were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 31 subjects (mean age 53.2 years, 77.4% female) with insomnia disorder recruited from a community.
study_duration: 4 weeks of intervention, with follow-up at week 8.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of acupuncture-related techniques, particularly acupressure, in treating psoriasis and to rank their efficacy compared to other interventions.
results_summary: Acupressure and acupoint catgut embedding were found to be significantly effective for improving psoriasis, with acupressure being the most effective treatment. Short-term effects were superior to long-term effects, but adverse events like thirst and dry mouth were noted.
population_specificity: 1,060 participants with psoriasis across 13 randomized controlled trials.
study_duration: Short-term and long-term effects were compared, but exact duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether acupressure therapy improves ankle sprain recovery compared to standard RICE treatment.
results_summary: Acupressure therapy significantly reduced swelling, improved ankle movement, decreased pain, and enhanced quality of life scores compared to standard treatment and mock acupressure groups. The effects were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: 62 patients with acute ankle sprains treated within 48 hours of injury in Chinese hospitals.
effective_dosage: 3 sessions of acupressure treatment (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of auricular point acupressure (APA) on axial neck pain after anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF) surgery.
results_summary: APA treatment reduced axial neck pain severity, improved quality of life (SF-36 scores), and decreased inflammatory markers (IL-1β, IL-6, TNF-α) compared to sham treatment.
population_specificity: Patients recovering from ACDF surgery at Shaoxing Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine.

study_goal: To assess the feasibility and tolerability of acupressure/acupuncture in children with ASD and evaluate measures for capturing behavioral and regulatory impacts.
results_summary: Children tolerated the intervention well, and parents adhered to the protocol. The study suggested potential improvements in behavioral and regulatory functions, warranting further rigorous evaluation.
population_specificity: 10 children aged 3-10 years with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and one parent each.
effective_dosage: 16 biweekly treatment sessions (acupressure/acupuncture) plus daily home-based acupressure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure could effectively reduce postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in patients with a history of PONV and motion sickness.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure significantly decreased nausea during the PACU stay and within 24 hours postoperatively, with statistically significant differences compared to placebo and sham groups. The effect may be influenced by reduced narcotic requirements or subjective perception of nausea.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing general anesthesia with a history of PONV and motion sickness.
effective_dosage: Not specified (three auricular acupressure points: shen men, point zero, and subcortex point).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a 12-week TCM-principle guided acupressure intervention on the quality of life (QOL) of frail older people living in the community.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in the physical domain of QOL, sleep quality, and pain intensity in the treatment group compared to the control group. Within-group analysis also confirmed the positive impact of acupressure on these areas.
population_specificity: Frail older people (mean age 76.12 ± 7.08) living in the community.
effective_dosage: 15 minutes of acupressure treatment, four times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure at the Zusanli (ST-36) acupoint could effectively reduce blood glucose levels in patients with diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure at ST-36 significantly reduced blood sugar levels compared to the control group, with a mean difference of 99.14 and statistical significance (Bonferroni sig. p=0.000). Acupressure was deemed effective for managing diabetes and reducing complications.
population_specificity: 30 participants with diabetes mellitus, split into experimental (15) and control (15) groups.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes per visit at the ST-36 acupoint.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure could alleviate postoperative ileus (POI) symptoms after cesarean section.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly reduced the time to bowel sounds, first flatus, and postoperative bed rest, but did not significantly affect time to first defecation. It showed potential as a low-cost, noninvasive treatment for POI.
population_specificity: 120 patients who underwent cesarean section.
effective_dosage: Two 20-minute acupressure sessions (first session an hour after attending the women's division, second session 3 hours after the first).
study_duration: Approximately 4 hours (two sessions within 3 hours of each other).

study_goal: To determine the effectiveness of acupressure, along with acupuncture and chiropractic interventions, on the treatment of chronic nonspecific low back pain in Iran.
results_summary: The systematic review suggests that acupressure may have a favorable effect on self-reported pain and functional limitations in chronic nonspecific low back pain, but results are limited by study heterogeneity and low methodological quality.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic nonspecific low back pain in Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of acupressure in preventing chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting across three categories.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that acupressure reduced the severity of acute and delayed nausea but showed no benefit on the incidence or frequency of vomiting. The study concluded that more well-designed trials with larger sample sizes are needed for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: 1419 patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure at LIV3 and LI4 points on quality of life, PMS symptoms, anxiety, and depression in women with PMS.
results_summary: Acupressure at LIV3 and LI4 significantly reduced moderate/severe PMS symptoms, depression, and anxiety, and improved quality of life compared to placebo, with no significant difference between the two acupoints.
population_specificity: Female students with PMS at Hormozgan University of Medical Sciences, Iran.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of acupressure daily for 14 days before menstruation over three consecutive menstrual cycles.
study_duration: Three menstrual cycles (training cycle plus two self-applied cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of acupressure at the Neiguan point (P6) as an adjuvant treatment for severe nausea and vomiting in pregnancy during inpatient management.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure at the Neiguan point significantly improved nausea, vomiting, and retching symptoms, reduced ketonuria, and shortened hospital stays compared to placebo. The only reported side effect was mild wrist redness.
population_specificity: Low-risk, spontaneously conceived singleton pregnancies with hyperemesis gravidarum.
effective_dosage: Acupressure band worn for 12 hours daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether acupressure therapy (targeting PC6, LI4, and HT7 points) improves postoperative patient satisfaction and quality of recovery compared to sham or no intervention.
results_summary: The study protocol suggests acupressure may improve postoperative recovery, nausea, vomiting, pain, and sleep, but specific results are not provided in the abstract. The trial compares active acupressure, sham acupressure, and no intervention to assess efficacy.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients recovering from surgical treatment.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied three times a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify current evidence on integrative therapeutic approaches, including acupressure, for controlling chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) in children with cancer.
results_summary: The review found little information on the effectiveness and safety of most integrative therapies, including acupressure, for CINV in children, though some adult and pediatric studies suggested promising interventions for further testing.
population_specificity: Children with cancer undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure therapy could reduce stress and improve sleep status in middle-aged women in South Korea.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in physical and psychological stress, cortisol levels, and sleep status in the experimental group compared to the placebo control group.
population_specificity: Middle-aged women in Seoul, South Korea (67 participants: 35 experimental, 32 control).
effective_dosage: Auricular acupressure therapy applied 2 times per week for 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if acupuncture at the EX-HN3 (Yintang) point reduces pre-operative anxiety levels in neurosurgical patients.
results_summary: Acupuncture at the EX-HN3 point significantly reduced pre-operative anxiety levels in neurosurgical patients, with no adverse events reported. The control group showed no change in anxiety levels.
population_specificity: Neurosurgical patients awaiting procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of acupressure on sleep quality through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a 13%-19% improvement in sleep quality (measured by PSQI) with acupressure compared to sham treatments, with low heterogeneity. Subgroup analyses explored acupoint usage and PSQI domain contributions.
population_specificity: 968 adult patients across 13 trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the perioperative use of acupuncture for various conditions, focusing on its effects on preoperative anxiety, postoperative pain, and nausea/vomiting.
results_summary: The study suggests acupuncture may reduce preoperative anxiety, decrease postoperative analgesic requirements, and lower the incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting.
population_specificity: Patients in the perioperative period (pre- and post-surgery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure significantly reduces pain in leukemia patients compared to standard treatment alone.
results_summary: No significant differences in pain levels were found between the acupressure and control groups across 12 interventions, but both groups reported significant short-term pain reduction after each session. The study suggests acupressure may provide temporary pain relief but lacks long-term efficacy evidence.
population_specificity: Hospitalized leukemia patients
study_duration: February to June 2015 (exact session duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of LI4 and BL32 acupressure on labor pain and delivery outcomes against a control group.
results_summary: Acupressure on LI4 and BL32 points significantly reduced labor pain compared to the control group, with BL32 showing slightly superior pain relief in early labor stages. No significant differences were observed in delivery outcomes.
population_specificity: 105 primiparous women in the active phase of the first stage of labor.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied at three cervical dilatations (4-5, 6-7, and 8-10 cm).
study_duration: Duration of labor (specific time not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure could relieve constipation in breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure significantly reduced constipation-assessment scores, improved stool-form scores, and lowered Patient Assessment of Constipation-Quality of Life scores compared to usual care. The intervention was deemed effective, safe, and acceptable.
population_specificity: 52 breast cancer patients receiving chemotherapy at E University Hospital, Seoul, Korea.
effective_dosage: Vaccaria seeds applied to seven auricular acupoints (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of SP6 acupressure for relieving primary dysmenorrhea symptoms and assess patients' experiences with the intervention.
results_summary: SP6 acupressure delivered by trained personnel significantly reduced pain intensity immediately and up to 3 hours post-intervention, while self-administered acupressure required multiple monthly cycles for pain reduction. The included studies were generally of low quality with a high risk of bias.
population_specificity: Individuals with primary dysmenorrhea (461 participants across 6 studies).
study_duration: Immediate effects noted post-intervention; pain relief persisted up to 3 hours. Self-administered intervention required multiple monthly cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of self-administered acupressure in reducing caregiver stress and improving symptoms of fatigue, insomnia, depression, and health-related quality of life in Chinese family caregivers.
results_summary: The study hypothesized that acupressure would reduce stress and improve symptoms in caregivers, but results were not explicitly stated in the abstract. The trial design suggests potential efficacy, pending outcome data.
population_specificity: Chinese primary caregivers aged ≥21 years of older family members, screening positive for stress and symptoms of fatigue/insomnia/depression.
effective_dosage: Individual learning and practice sessions twice a week for 2 weeks, home follow-up visits once a week for 2 weeks, and 15-min self-practice twice a day for 6 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nonpharmacologic management, including acupressure, in treating neonatal abstinence syndrome (NAS) symptoms.
results_summary: Acupressure, along with other nonpharmacologic therapies, was shown to have positive effects on newborns with NAS, including reduced length of stay, lower NAS scores, decreased need for pharmacologic treatment, and improved sleep quality.
population_specificity: Newborns with neonatal abstinence syndrome (NAS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of acupressure for treating nausea and vomiting in pregnancy (NVP) and hyperemesis gravidarum (HG).
results_summary: The study found some evidence of symptom improvement with acupressure, but data quality and heterogeneity limited definitive conclusions. Results may not be generalizable across all severities of NVP/HG.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with nausea and vomiting (NVP) or hyperemesis gravidarum (HG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the historical context, mechanisms, and clinical applications of acupuncture and related techniques, including acupressure, in treating functional disorders and pain.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that acupuncture and related methods, including acupressure, are effective for pain relief and treating functional disorders, supported by clinical trials and neurophysiological mechanisms like the gate-control theory and endogenous opioids.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of clinical applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of acupressure on the duration of labor and mode of delivery in parturient women.
results_summary: Acupressure increased the likelihood of vaginal delivery and reduced the duration of both the active phase and second stage of labor compared to placebo or no intervention.
population_specificity: Parturient women (those in childbirth)
study_duration: Duration of labor (intervention administered during childbirth)

study_goal: To examine the effect of auricular acupressure therapy on primary dysmenorrhea among female high school students in South Korea.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure therapy significantly reduced abdominal pain, back pain, and primary dysmenorrhea compared to the placebo control group, with statistically significant differences (p < .001).
population_specificity: Female high school students in South Korea (average age 16.7 years).
effective_dosage: Auricular acupressure needle on skin paper tape applied to specific acupoints (Jagung, Sinmun, Gyogam, Naebunbi) for 3 days during periods of extreme primary dysmenorrhea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure applied to the sanyinjiao point could effectively reduce pain in pregnant women during active labor.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly reduced pain immediately after treatment and at 1-hour follow-up compared to placebo and control groups, though initial pain levels were similar across all groups.
population_specificity: 156 pregnant women (≥37 weeks gestation) with cervical dilation ≥4 cm and ≥2 contractions in 10 minutes.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied during contractions for 20 minutes.
study_duration: 20 minutes per session, with pain assessed immediately after and at 1-hour follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure could effectively relieve nausea and vomiting in women undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure significantly reduced the number and intensity of nausea and vomiting episodes in both acute and delayed phases compared to the control group, with statistical significance (P = 0.001). The study suggests it as a complementary, non-pharmacological treatment option.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy (n=48).
effective_dosage: Not specified (auricular acupressure applied for five days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits and harms of acupuncture-related interventions, including acupressure, for symptom management in adults with chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: Manual acupressure showed short-term reductions in depression, fatigue, and sleep disturbance scores in hemodialysis patients, but evidence was of very low quality. Safety data were incomplete, with few reported adverse events.
population_specificity: Adults with CKD stages 3-5, including pre-dialysis and end-stage kidney disease patients on hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis.
study_duration: Outcomes measured for up to two months in most studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure on initiating labor in nulliparous pregnant women.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in spontaneous labor initiation between acupressure, sham acupressure, and control groups at 48h, 49-96h, or 97h after intervention. Secondary outcomes also showed no significant differences.
population_specificity: 162 nulliparous pregnant women admitted to the hospital.
effective_dosage: Acupressure points SP6, BL60, and BL32 were pressured bilaterally every other day between 9 am and 11 am.
study_duration: Intervention was carried out on women in the afternoon and the following day, with follow-up at 48h, 96h, and hospitalization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure training improves sleep quality and cognitive function in older adults with impaired sleep.
results_summary: Acupressure training improved older adults' sleep quality and cognitive function, though sleep did not mediate the relationship between acupressure and cognitive function. The intervention was noted as easy, simple, and safe.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling older adults in China with impaired sleep quality.
effective_dosage: Individual and small group acupressure training sessions plus daily self-practice (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 6 weeks of self-administered relaxing or stimulating acupressure could improve fatigue, sleep, and quality of life in breast cancer survivors compared to usual care, and whether these effects persisted during a 4-week washout period.
results_summary: Both types of acupressure significantly reduced persistent fatigue compared to usual care, with relaxing acupressure also improving sleep quality and quality of life. The effects on fatigue were sustained at the 10-week follow-up, but sleep improvements were only significant at week 6 for relaxing acupressure.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors (stages 0-III) who had completed cancer treatments at least 12 months prior.
effective_dosage: Daily self-administered acupressure (relaxing or stimulating) for 6 weeks.
study_duration: 6 weeks of intervention, with a 4-week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupressure and transcutaneous electrical acupoint stimulation (TEAS) in reducing uremic pruritus in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Both acupressure and TEAS significantly reduced discomfort from uremic pruritus compared to the control group, with no notable difference in efficacy between the two methods.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with uremic pruritus in Turkey.
effective_dosage: Treatment applied 3 times per week for 4 weeks (12 sessions total) on the LI-11 acupuncture points.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of auricular point acupressure (APP) using vaccaria seeds on the large intestine point (CO7) for treating gastrointestinal dysfunction after laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
results_summary: The study was designed as a double-blind, randomized, controlled trial to assess APP's effects on postoperative gastrointestinal dysfunction, with primary outcomes including time to first passage of flatus and secondary outcomes like abdominal distension, nausea, and quality of life. Results were not explicitly stated in the abstract, but the study aimed to provide objective evidence for APP's clinical use.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients who underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy at Tianjin Nankai Hospital.
effective_dosage: APP therapy (or sham stimulation) was performed 6 h after surgery and every 12 h subsequently, with six sessions lasting 3 min each.
study_duration: The intervention lasted for approximately 72 hours (six sessions over 3 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of acupressure (applied at P6) on chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in patients with acute myeloblastic leukemia.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure bands reduced the number and severity of nausea-vomiting episodes (statistically significant), while finger pressure acupressure did not show a significant effect.
population_specificity: Patients with acute myeloblastic leukemia receiving chemotherapy and antiemetic therapy.
effective_dosage: Acupressure bands applied continuously for 4 days; finger pressure applied for 4 days (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness and safety of acupressure in treating primary dysmenorrhoea compared to sham/placebo, no treatment, or conventional medical treatment.
results_summary: The study found inconsistent and inconclusive evidence for acupressure's effectiveness in reducing pain, with low-quality evidence overall. No adverse events were reported in any acupressure studies.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age with primary dysmenorrhoea experiencing moderate to severe symptoms during the majority of menstrual cycles or for three consecutive cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of a study evaluating the efficacy of self-administered acupressure for pain and symptom management in older adults with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found high adherence (80%) and fidelity (94%) to acupressure protocols, with 10% reporting discomfort and most adverse events related to pre-existing conditions. Recruitment was challenging, but the study concluded that self-administered acupressure is feasible for this population.
population_specificity: Community-living older adults (mean age 73) with symptomatic knee osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Self-administered acupressure once daily, 5 days a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of electrical stimulation (ES) of auricular acupressure in reducing ocular symptoms and signs of dry eye.
results_summary: The treatment group showed significantly better scores in tear film break-up time, Schirmer test-I, and ocular symptoms at 3 months post-treatment compared to the control group, with an 82% total effective rate.
population_specificity: Dry eye patients with tear film break-up time below 5 s and Schirmer test-I below 5 mm, experiencing symptoms for at least 6 months.
effective_dosage: Continuous low-frequency ES at 4 master points of both ears, twice a week for 4 weeks, 30 seconds per point.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acupuncture and related therapies, including acupressure, for palliative cancer care, focusing on outcomes like pain, fatigue, and quality of life.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly reduced fatigue in lung cancer patients compared to sham acupressure. Acupuncture and related therapies also reduced pain and improved quality of life in specific cancer populations.
population_specificity: Cancer patients, including those with liver, gastric, gastrointestinal, and lung cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), which incorporates acupressure, in reducing psychological distress, particularly anxiety, compared to control treatments.
results_summary: EFT demonstrated a significant pre-post effect size (1.23) in reducing psychological distress, outperforming control treatments (effect size 0.41). However, insufficient data were available to compare EFT directly to standard treatments like cognitive behavioral therapy.
population_specificity: 658 participants across 14 randomized controlled trials (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of standardized auricular acupressure using Vaccaria segetalis on dyspnea intensity, distress, and oxygen saturation in end-stage lung cancer patients.
results_summary: Non-parametric analyses indicated medium to large effects of acupressure, with a significant effect on dyspnea effort, suggesting potential benefits for dyspnea management in this population.
population_specificity: 11 hospice patients with advanced lung cancer and dyspnea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of acupressure/acupuncture for hyperemesis gravidarum compared to placebo or other interventions.
results_summary: The study found no clear evidence of differences between acupuncture and placebo for outcomes like anxiodepressive symptoms, spontaneous abortion, preterm birth, or perinatal death. Comparisons between acupuncture and metoclopramide also showed insufficient evidence to identify clear differences in reducing nausea or vomiting.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with hyperemesis gravidarum up to 20 weeks' gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure therapy could improve sleep quality in women with postpartum insomnia.
results_summary: The study found that auricular acupressure significantly improved sleep quality, reducing Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index scores by 36% and improving subscale scores for sleep quality, latency, duration, and disturbance. The intervention was deemed effective for postpartum women with insomnia.
population_specificity: Postpartum women with insomnia in Northern Taiwan.
effective_dosage: Auricular acupressure on the Shenmen point four times a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding a self-acupressure pillow (SAP) to typical chiropractic care improves outcomes for tension-type and cervicogenic headache sufferers.
results_summary: Chiropractic care alone reduced weekly headache frequency by 46%, while the SAP group showed a 28% reduction. The SAP group reported moderate satisfaction (63%) but lower efficacy compared to chiropractic-only treatment.
population_specificity: Tension-type and cervicogenic headache sufferers aged 21-60.
effective_dosage: Daily home use of the SAP (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of acupressure versus sham treatment for inducing labor in nulliparous women with post-dates pregnancies.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between acupressure and sham treatment in labor induction outcomes, including treatment-to-commencement of labor interval, oxytocin requirements, or mode of delivery. Fewer inductions were required in the sham group, and neonatal outcomes were similar for both.
population_specificity: Nulliparous women with post-dates pregnancies (>41 weeks gestation) and no significant medical, obstetric, or fetal conditions.
effective_dosage: 20 intermittent presses per acupressure point (Large Intestine 4 and Spleen 6).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure could reduce anxiety, fatigue, cortisol levels, blood pressure, and heart rate in postpartum women after cesarean section.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure significantly reduced cortisol levels, heart rate, anxiety, and fatigue compared to usual care at 5 days postpartum. The intervention group showed clinically meaningful improvements across all measured outcomes.
population_specificity: Postpartum women who underwent cesarean section.
effective_dosage: Auricular acupressure on the shenmen acupoint twice daily (9 AM and 5 PM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of maternal supportive care and acupressure (at BL32 acupoint) on labor length and infant's Apgar score.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly reduced the length of the first and second stages of labor compared to the control group and increased the frequency of Apgar scores >8 in the first and 5th minutes.
population_specificity: 150 women with low-risk pregnancy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness and safety of PC6 acupoint stimulation (including acupressure) with or without antiemetic drugs versus sham or antiemetic drugs for preventing postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in surgical patients.
results_summary: PC6 acupoint stimulation significantly reduced nausea, vomiting, and the need for rescue antiemetics compared to sham treatment, with low-quality evidence. It showed no significant difference compared to antiemetic drugs alone (moderate-quality evidence) and inconclusive evidence when combined with antiemetics. Side effects were minor and transient.
population_specificity: People undergoing surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (various techniques like acupuncture, electro-acupuncture, acupressure, etc., were used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether acupuncture at P6 could effectively reduce gagging and allow successful completion of dental procedures.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in gag reduction or successful dental procedure completion between acupuncture at P6 and sham acupuncture. The evidence was of very low quality, and no noteworthy adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Adults with a history of nausea during dental procedures that hindered or prevented treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the most frequently described or systematically investigated conservative treatment options for stress urinary incontinence in women, including acupressure.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that alternative therapies such as acupressure were explored in the literature review, but the focus of the article was on pelvic floor muscle training and intravaginal support devices, with no specific findings reported for acupressure.
population_specificity: Women with stress urinary incontinence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of auricular point acupressure on sleep quality in individuals with chronic low back pain and assess the relationship between pain intensity and sleep quality.
results_summary: Participants receiving auricular point acupressure showed improved sleep quality, reduced daytime disturbance, and better global Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index scores compared to the sham group. Sleep duration and wake after sleep onset also decreased gradually during the 4-week intervention.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic low back pain (n = 61, split into APA and sham-APA groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and tolerability of auricular point acupressure (APA) for managing pain, fatigue, and sleep disturbance in breast cancer patients and to provide an initial appraisal of its effect size compared to a control intervention.
results_summary: The active APA group showed significant reductions in pain (71%), fatigue (44%), sleep disturbance (31%), and interference with daily activities (61%), while the control group experienced moderate symptom reductions. The study suggests APA may be an effective complementary approach for symptom management in breast cancer patients.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients experiencing pain, fatigue, and sleep disturbance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of acupressure on the sleep quality of haemodialysis patients.
results_summary: True acupressure significantly improved sleep quality (Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index score decreased from 11.9 to 6.2), while sham acupressure and no treatment showed minimal changes. The difference between groups was statistically significant (p<0.001).
population_specificity: Haemodialysis patients with sleep disorders.
effective_dosage: Treatment administered three times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether acupressure at Kun Lun (UB60) and Taixi (K3) points could effectively manage pain in preterm infants undergoing heel lancing for blood collection.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure at UB60 and K3 points before heel lancing was associated with shorter procedural time and reduced crying duration in preterm infants, though no significant differences were observed in pain scores between the acupressure and control groups.
population_specificity: Preterm infants (28-36 weeks' gestational age) in a neonatal intensive care unit.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied for three minutes at UB60 and K3 points immediately before the procedure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore sham acupressure procedures in trials, assess if different sham interventions yield different outcomes, and identify directions for developing an adequate sham acupressure method.
results_summary: Acupressure was beneficial for various health problems, with true acupressure groups showing more effectiveness than sham groups. No clear association was found between different sham modalities and treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: 7,265 participants across 66 studies (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of various types of acupuncture, including acupressure, in treating asthma in children.
results_summary: Some studies showed significant improvements in peak expiratory flow (PEF) variability and asthma-specific anxiety levels with acupuncture, while others reported no significant differences in lung function parameters or quality of life. A recent study indicated that acupuncture paired with acupressure reduced medication use and symptoms in preschool-age children.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents (<18 years) with asthma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the feasibility and preliminary efficacy of PC 6 acupoint stimulation via beaded wristbands versus placebo for reducing post-operative nausea and vomiting in cardiac surgery patients.
results_summary: The study found a clinically significant reduction in vomiting in the intervention group, suggesting that a larger trial is feasible and justified. The intervention was well-tolerated, with no major adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Cardiac surgery patients (n=80).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence from RCTs and quantify the effects of acupressure on anxiety among adults.
results_summary: The meta-analysis of five RCTs showed a significant reduction in anxiety in the acupressure group compared to sham controls, with a medium effect size. However, conflicting results were found for improvements in physiological indicators.
population_specificity: Adults experiencing anxiety from the anticipation of surgery or treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether an acupressure backrest could improve pain and disability in office workers with low back pain and whether user preference influenced outcomes.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in pain and disability after 1 month of acupressure backrest use, with effects lasting up to 3 months. No difference was observed between randomized and preferred backrest groups, indicating preference did not moderate treatment effects.
population_specificity: Office workers suffering from low back pain.
effective_dosage: Not specified (acupressure backrest used for 1 month).
study_duration: 1 month (with follow-up at 2 weeks, 4 weeks, and 3 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the components of intervention fidelity in an acupressure study for breast cancer survivors with persistent cancer-related fatigue (PCRF) and evaluate its efficacy.
results_summary: The study incorporated all 5 fidelity components (dose, training, delivery, receipt, and enactment) and suggests that acupressure can serve as a model for future research. Participants logged fatigue levels and session frequency, but specific efficacy results are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors with moderate-to-severe PCRF lasting over 1 year post-treatment, primarily Caucasian, married, and with some college education.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes daily for 6 weeks (either relaxing or stimulating acupressure).
study_duration: 6 weeks (with follow-up assessments up to 10 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a 4-week auricular point acupressure (APA) treatment on chronic low back pain (CLBP) outcomes and examine day-to-day pain variability.
results_summary: Participants in the real APA group showed a 30% reduction in worst pain after the first day and a 44% reduction by the end of the 4-week intervention, reaching clinically significant levels. Analgesic use was also reduced compared to the sham group.
population_specificity: 61 participants with chronic low back pain recruited from primary care offices, clinics, or a research registry.
effective_dosage: One APA treatment per week for 4 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure on fatigue in women with multiple sclerosis.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in fatigue scores in the acupressure group compared to the placebo group immediately, two weeks, and four weeks after the intervention.
population_specificity: 100 women with multiple sclerosis from the Tehran MS Association.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied at true points (ST36, SP6, LI4); frequency not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupressure versus reflexology in managing premenstrual syndrome among adolescent girls.
results_summary: The study found that reflexology was more effective than acupressure in improving premenstrual syndrome symptoms, with group II (reflexology) showing a higher mean post-test score (70.8) compared to group I (acupressure) (97.3). The results were statistically significant, but no significant association was found between post-test scores and demographic variables.
population_specificity: Adolescent girls with premenstrual syndrome from Government Girls Secondary School, Erode.
effective_dosage: Acupressure was administered once a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of self-administered acupressure on mood levels in college students majoring in acupuncture and moxibustion medicine.
results_summary: The study found that self-administered acupressure significantly improved mood levels in the intervention group compared to the control group, with no reported side effects. The improvements included reductions in tension-anxiety, depression-dejection, anger-hostility, and increases in vigor, with no changes in fatigue or confusion.
population_specificity: 54 college students (34 males, 20 females) majoring in acupuncture and moxibustion medicine in Fukuoka, Japan.
effective_dosage: Five acupressure sessions three times daily (morning, noon, night), applying pressure to six acupuncture points (GB12, SI17, LI18) for 5 seconds each.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of aroma-acupressure and aromatherapy on agitation in patients with dementia.
results_summary: Aroma-acupressure significantly reduced agitation scores and improved parasympathetic nervous activity more effectively than aromatherapy, though both interventions showed benefits. The effects were sustained over a three-week follow-up period.
population_specificity: Patients with dementia exhibiting agitation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure affects labour onset and duration of labour, particularly in reducing labour time and pain levels.
results_summary: The review found that acupressure may reduce the length of labour, especially in the first stage, based on seven trials involving 748 women. However, further research is needed to confirm its effectiveness in initiating labour or augmenting prolonged labour.
population_specificity: Primiparous and/or multiparous women with either spontaneous or induced onset of labour.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and acceptability of auricular acupressure (AA) on specific acupoints versus non-specific acupoints for treating insomnia in maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients.
results_summary: AA on specific acupoints showed a higher response rate (62.5%) compared to sham AA (32.3%), with a significant reduction in PSQI scores. No adverse events related to AA were reported, though three participants died during follow-up unrelated to the intervention.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients with insomnia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (AA applied for eight weeks).
study_duration: Eight weeks of intervention, with a 12-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure on relieving anxiety in women with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).
results_summary: The acupressure group showed significantly lower anxiety compared to the placebo group (p ≤ .0001), indicating that acupressure was effective in reducing anxiety in diabetic pregnant women.
population_specificity: 60 women with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) at a university hospital.
effective_dosage: Not specified (nurse-provided acupressure at true point).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of auricular acupressure on heart rate variability (HRV) and quality of life (QoL) in hypertensive patients.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure improved body pain and mental health aspects of QoL but showed no significant effects on HRV parameters, heart rate, blood pressure, or overall QoL. The intervention was deemed acceptable and feasible despite lacking physiological benefits.
population_specificity: 150 participants from a medical teaching hospital with hypertension.
effective_dosage: Not specified (acupoints used: shenmen, sympathesis, kidney, liver, heart, and subcortex).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure at the SP6 point could reduce labor duration and cesarean section rates in parturients.
results_summary: Acupressure at the SP6 point significantly reduced labor duration compared to placebo and control groups, but it did not affect cesarean section rates or Apgar scores of the neonates.
population_specificity: 156 pregnant women with gestational age ≥ 37 weeks, cervical dilation ≥ 4 cm, and ≥ 2 contractions in 10 min, served in a public maternity hospital in Brazil.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied to the SP6 point during contractions for 20 min.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of Nei-Guan (P6) acupressure wristbands on postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in patients undergoing thyroidectomy.
results_summary: The study found that P6 acupressure significantly reduced nausea in the recovery room compared to placebo and control groups, but it did not affect vomiting or retching. The effect was short-term and limited to the immediate postoperative period.
population_specificity: Sixty Korean female patients undergoing thyroidectomy.
effective_dosage: Wristband applied at the P6 acupoint 30 minutes before anesthesia and removed before leaving the recovery room.
study_duration: Single application during the perioperative period (from 30 minutes before anesthesia until recovery room discharge).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and analyze the efficacy and safety of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) treatments, including acupressure, for neck pain (NP) and low back pain (LBP).
results_summary: The study found that acupressure could be efficacious in treating pain and disability associated with chronic neck pain (CNP) or chronic low back pain (CLBP) in the immediate term, with no serious or life-threatening adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: Individuals experiencing chronic neck pain (CNP) or chronic low back pain (CLBP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of self-administered acupressure in alleviating symptoms of various health problems, including allergic disease, cancer, respiratory disease, dysmenorrhea, stress, insomnia, and sleep disturbances.
results_summary: The study found that self-administered acupressure showed positive effects and safety in clinically diverse populations, with significant improvements in symptom scores for allergic disease, nausea and vomiting in cancer, respiratory disease symptoms, dysmenorrhea pain, and stress/fatigue and sleep disturbances in healthy individuals.
population_specificity: Clinically diverse populations, including individuals with allergic disease, cancer, respiratory disease, dysmenorrhea, and healthy people with stress/fatigue and sleep disturbances.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore participants' perceptions of the consent process in a sham-controlled acupressure trial for chemotherapy-related nausea, without explicitly informing them about the possibility of receiving a sham intervention.
results_summary: Participants believed they were fully informed during consent and found it acceptable not to disclose the sham intervention. However, many assumed one treatment arm was placebo, potentially undermining the trial's methodological validity.
population_specificity: Chemotherapy patients experiencing nausea from three UK sites (Manchester, Liverpool, and Plymouth).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether perineal self-acupressure improves quality of life and bowel function in patients with functional constipation compared to standard treatment options alone.
results_summary: The study found that perineal self-acupressure significantly improved quality of life (PAC-QOL), bowel function (modified BFI), and physical health (SF-12v2) compared to the control group, with statistically significant differences. Mental health improvements were also noted but were less statistically robust.
population_specificity: 100 adult patients meeting Rome III criteria for functional constipation.
effective_dosage: Not specified (training in perineal self-acupressure provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the efficacy of PC6 acupoint stimulation versus placebo for reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in cardiac surgery patients and to understand factors influencing its clinical use.
results_summary: The study evaluated PC6 acupressure's impact on PONV, rescue antiemetic use, quality of recovery, and cost, alongside patient satisfaction and staff feedback on feasibility and acceptability. Results were not fully detailed in the abstract, but the trial design suggests rigorous evaluation of efficacy and implementation.
population_specificity: Post-cardiac surgery patients (n=712).
effective_dosage: Wristbands providing acupressure to PC6 acupoint, worn continuously.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of supportive care and acupressure on pain intensity and delivery outcomes in pregnant women during labor.
results_summary: The study found that both supportive care and acupressure significantly reduced pain intensity and improved delivery outcomes, with higher rates of natural vaginal delivery in these groups compared to the control group.
population_specificity: 150 pregnant women in labor, divided into supportive care, acupressure, and control groups.
effective_dosage: BL32 acupoint was pressed during contractions (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Duration of labor (exact time not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of acupressure compared to sham-acupressure and usual care on agitation in people with dementia (PWD) in nursing homes.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, but it is designed to provide higher-quality evidence on acupressure's effectiveness for agitation in PWD, including its potential effects on stress, delayed effects, placebo interactions, and psychotropic drug use.
population_specificity: People with dementia (PWD) over 65 years of age in nursing homes experiencing agitation.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied at Fengchi (GB20), Baihui (GV20), Shenmen (HT7), Niguan (PC6), and Yingtang (EX-HN3) acupoints (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Acupressure (including other acupoints massages) improves sleep quality in uraemic patients on dialysis compared to controls.
results_summary: Acupressure showed a significant reduction in PSQI scores (SMD 1.77, 95% CI 0.80-2.73), indicating improved sleep quality, though results should be interpreted cautiously due to methodological concerns.
population_specificity: Uraemic patients on dialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a 10-week intervention of auricular electrical stimulation combined with auricular acupressure on weight reduction in obese outpatients.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in body mass index, blood pressure, total cholesterol, triglyceride, and leptin or adiponectin over time within the group, but not between the experimental and sham groups. The results could not exclude the effect of placebo and dietary consultation.
population_specificity: Obese outpatients
effective_dosage: Not specified (stimulation delivered in the same manner for both true and sham acupoints)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ear acupressure (EAP) is effective and safe for managing symptoms of perennial allergic rhinitis (PAR).
results_summary: The study found that real EAP significantly improved global quality of life and reduced symptoms like total nasal symptoms, runny nose, and eye symptoms compared to sham EAP. Both real and sham EAP were well tolerated, with only two severe adverse events reported, unrelated to the procedure.
population_specificity: Participants with perennial allergic rhinitis (PAR) from two centers in Melbourne, Australia, and Guangzhou, China.
effective_dosage: EAP stimulation administered three times daily, with treatment once a week for 8 weeks.
study_duration: 8 weeks of treatment followed by 12 weeks of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of acupressure on depression, anxiety, stress, and general psychological distress in patients undergoing hemodialysis.
results_summary: The acupressure group showed significantly lower scores for depression, anxiety, stress, and general psychological distress compared to the control group, though social dysfunction scores remained similar between groups.
population_specificity: Patients with end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis (n=108).
effective_dosage: 15 minutes of acupressure applied three times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of ear acupuncture, ear acupressure, and auriculotherapy on cigarette smoking cessation at various follow-up intervals.
results_summary: Ear acupressure (EAPR) showed superior efficacy compared to inactive controls at end-of-treatment, 3 months, and 6 months follow-up, but data was insufficient at 12 months. EAPR was neither inferior nor superior to behavioral therapy or body acupuncture at 3 and 6 months.
population_specificity: 3,735 participants in randomized controlled trials focused on cigarette smoking cessation.
study_duration: Follow-up periods included end-of-treatment, 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months (though 12-month data was insufficient).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects (benefits and harms) of acupuncture, including acupressure, for treating acute ankle sprains in adults.
results_summary: The study found inconsistent and very low-quality evidence regarding acupuncture's effectiveness for ankle sprains, with some trials favoring acupuncture but results being highly heterogeneous. No reliable conclusions could be drawn about safety due to insufficient reporting of adverse events.
population_specificity: Adults with acute ankle sprains.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of press needle acupuncture, no treatment, and press plaster acupressure on post-anesthetic recovery and postoperative pain in patients undergoing laparoscopic surgery.
results_summary: The study did not report specific results for acupressure, as it was a pilot trial designed to compare acupuncture and acupressure with no treatment; the primary outcome was time from extubation to readiness for discharge.
population_specificity: 75 patients scheduled for laparoscopic surgery to the uterus or ovaries.
effective_dosage: 12 press plasters administered preoperatively at seven acupuncture points.
study_duration: The intervention was administered preoperatively, with observation from one day before surgery to the second postoperative day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current evidence from systematic reviews on acupuncture and acupressure for pain management in labour and birth, and to assess the methodological and treatment frameworks applied to this evidence.
results_summary: The systematic reviews included RCTs with varying study designs, treatment protocols, and outcome measures, yielding conflicting results. While trials of acupuncture and acupressure in labour show promise, further studies are needed to draw definitive conclusions on efficacy.
population_specificity: Women with low-risk pregnancies and births.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of physiotherapeutic interventions, including acupressure, on pain and quality of life in women with primary dysmenorrhea compared to control groups.
results_summary: Acupressure showed a statistically significant reduction in pain severity (weighted mean difference 1.4 on a 0-10 scale) compared to no treatment, but no significant difference was found when compared to sham controls, suggesting placebo effects.
population_specificity: Women with primary dysmenorrhea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the correlation between heart rate variability (HRV), meridian electrical conductance, and weight reduction effects of auricular acupressure (AA) in middle-aged women.
results_summary: AA did not significantly affect body weight or BMI but reduced waist circumference. It also lowered sympathetic nervous activity (indicated by HRV and meridian conductance changes) compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Middle-aged women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if self-measurement of Pressure Pain Sensitivity (PPS) followed by acupressure could reduce depressive symptoms and improve psychological well-being in patients with stable ischemic heart disease (IHD).
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly reduced PPS (28% decrease) and depressive symptoms (22% decrease) while improving well-being and quality of life compared to treatment as usual. The effects were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Patients with stable ischemic heart disease (IHD).
effective_dosage: Self-measurement of PPS twice daily followed by acupressure (specific acupressure technique not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupuncture combined with auricular acupressure is effective for relieving perimenopausal syndrome compared to hormone replacement therapy.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a comparison between acupuncture plus auricular acupressure and hormone replacement therapy, with primary and secondary outcomes measured over 36 weeks, but results are not yet available in the abstract.
population_specificity: 206 women with perimenopausal syndrome.
effective_dosage: Auricular points plastered by Semen Vaccariae twice per week for 12 weeks; acupuncture sessions three times per week for the first 4 weeks, then twice per week for the next 8 weeks (total 28 sessions).
study_duration: 12 weeks of intervention, with a 24-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure (AA) could reduce anxiety during IVF treatment and improve IVF outcomes.
results_summary: AA significantly reduced anxiety levels and improved clinical pregnancy, implantation, and live birth rates compared to sham-AA and control groups, potentially due to increased neuropeptide Y levels in follicular fluids.
population_specificity: 305 infertile patients with tubal blockage undergoing IVF.
study_duration: From trans-vaginal oocyte retrieval to embryo transfer (specific duration not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the complementary effects of auricular acupressure (AA) in relieving constipation symptoms and improving disease-specific health-related quality of life (HRQOL) among elderly residential care home residents.
results_summary: The experimental group (AA with magnetic pellets) showed the greatest improvement in constipation symptoms and HRQOL at both 10-day and 20-day follow-ups compared to placebo and usual care groups, with significant interaction effects noted for satisfaction subscales. AA was found to be safe and acceptable.
population_specificity: Elderly residents in Hong Kong residential care homes.
effective_dosage: AA applied to seven auricular acupoints for 10 days.
study_duration: 10 days of intervention, with follow-up at 20 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of a 4-week auricular point acupressure (APA) protocol for chronic pain and its effects on pain reduction (severity and interference).
results_summary: Participants reported reduced pain intensity (average 63-66% reduction) and fewer pain episodes, with 88% feeling "much better" and 96% decreasing analgesic use. However, adherence was moderate (60% completed the protocol).
population_specificity: Adult patients with chronic pain.
effective_dosage: 5 days with APA seeds taped onto the ear and 2 days without, per weekly cycle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether complementary therapies, including acupuncture and auricular acupressure, could reduce analgesia and anxiolytic requirements in patients undergoing shock wave lithotripsy (SWL).
results_summary: Acupuncture and auricular acupressure significantly reduced pain and anxiety in some studies, with no difference in stone-free rates. No major or minor side effects were reported.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing SWL for renal stones.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between weight changes and cardiometabolic biomarkers, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in South Asians at risk of diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that a 1 kg weight reduction was associated with a 2.5% reduction in ALT levels, indicating improved liver health. No clear differences in biomarker changes were observed between the intervention and control arms.
population_specificity: South Asians at risk of diabetes.

study_goal: The study did not investigate Alanine; it focused on the pharmacokinetics of Ivermectin (IVM) under high-fat meal conditions in Japanese patients with scabies.
results_summary: The study did not report any findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with scabies.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of dose-dense carboplatin and paclitaxel as a neoadjuvant treatment for operable breast cancer, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study reported a grade 3 alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation in one patient (0.91%), but the abstract does not focus on Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with previously untreated breast cancer (stages Ic-III).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify early gene expression indicators of acetaminophen-induced liver response, using alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a marker.
results_summary: ALT levels increased in responders between days 4 and 9, and 12 genes showed significantly altered expression within 24 hours, accurately classifying acetaminophen exposure. The gene profiles effectively separated subjects by dose and predicted exposure with 100% accuracy.
population_specificity: Healthy human subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a standardized Prunus mume extract on liver function, lipid profile, glycemia, and oxidative stress markers, including alanine aminotransferase, in healthy subjects with mildly elevated transaminases.
results_summary: The study found that the PM extract significantly improved liver function (reducing alanine aminotransferase by 47%), positively modified lipid profiles (increased HDL cholesterol by 13%), and demonstrated antioxidant effects (reduced oxidized glutathione and inflammation markers).
population_specificity: Healthy subjects (45 participants, aged 56.0 ± 11.6 years) with transaminase levels between 20 and 40 UI/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of microRNAs, particularly miR-122, as biomarkers for liver disease and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) detection, and their correlation with liver enzyme levels like alanine transaminase.
results_summary: The study found that miR-122 is liver-specific and correlates with liver enzyme levels and necroinflammatory activity, while other microRNAs are linked to fibrosis and viral infections like HBV and HCV. MicroRNA profiles vary between different liver conditions and could serve as early warning signs for HCC.
population_specificity: Patients with liver diseases, including hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), hepatitis B (HBV), and hepatitis C (HCV) infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of repeated cycles of recombinant human interleukin 7 (r-hIL-7) in restoring sustained CD4 T-cell counts >500 cells/µL in HIV-infected patients.
results_summary: Repeated cycles of r-hIL-7 were well tolerated, with one case of asymptomatic alanine aminotransferase elevation reported. The majority of participants achieved sustained CD4 T-cell restoration >500 cells/µL, with no impact from anti-r-hIL-7 binding antibodies.
population_specificity: HIV-infected patients on antiretroviral therapy with CD4 T-cell counts between 101 and 400 cells/µL and plasma HIV RNA levels <50 copies/mL.
effective_dosage: 20 µg/kg, administered as 3 weekly subcutaneous injections per cycle.
study_duration: Median follow-up of 23 months, with up to 4 cycles administered.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of enriched chicory inulin supplementation on liver enzymes, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and other metabolic parameters in female patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in AST and ALP concentrations in the chicory-treated group, but changes in ALT were not specifically highlighted. The intervention also improved glucose homeostasis and calcium levels.
population_specificity: Female patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the pharmacokinetic profile of lenvatinib and identify factors contributing to its interindividual variability in humans.
results_summary: The study found that lenvatinib's pharmacokinetics were best described by a three-compartment model with linear elimination, and its absorption involved simultaneous first- and zero-order processes. Covariates like body weight, liver function markers, and concomitant CYP3A4 inducers/inhibitors had small, clinically insignificant effects on lenvatinib clearance.
population_specificity: 779 subjects, including healthy individuals and patients with solid tumors or radioiodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC).
effective_dosage: 3.2-32 mg oral lenvatinib, mainly once daily as tablets or capsules.
interactions: Concomitant cytochrome P450 3A4 inducers (+30% effect on clearance) and inhibitors (-7.8% effect on clearance).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of (18)F-DOPA PET imaging in diagnosing Parkinson's disease (PD) and differentiating it from other movement disorders compared to SPET imaging.
results_summary: The study found that (18)F-DOPA PET imaging is the best diagnostic tool for PD and other movement disorders, with fluorine-18-FDG PET aiding in differential diagnosis between PD and other parkinsonian syndromes. Hybrid (18)F-DOPA PET/MRI showed potential for early diagnosis.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease, parkinsonian syndromes, essential tremor, and other movement disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of daclatasvir and asunaprevir therapy in patients receiving hemodialysis, focusing on HCV eradication and adverse effects, including serum alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that the therapy was highly effective in eradicating HCV in hemodialysis patients, with a 100% SVR12 rate, and comparable safety to non-renal dysfunction patients, including similar rates of serum alanine aminotransferase elevation.
population_specificity: Patients infected with HCV genotype 1, including 28 receiving hemodialysis and 56 without renal dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and antitumour activity of durvalumab plus tremelimumab in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that the combination therapy showed manageable tolerability and antitumour activity, with some dose-limiting toxicities and treatment-related adverse events. Clinical activity was observed in both PD-L1-positive and PD-L1-negative tumours.
population_specificity: Immunotherapy-naive patients aged 18 years or older with confirmed locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC.
effective_dosage: Durvalumab (3-20 mg/kg every 2-4 weeks) and tremelimumab (1-10 mg/kg every 4 weeks for six doses, then every 12 weeks for three doses).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of the Val16Ala-SOD2 polymorphism (involving alanine) on lipid profiles and inflammatory/fibrinolytic biomarkers in hypercholesterolemic patients treated with rosuvastatin.
results_summary: The study found that patients with the VV genotype (low-efficiency SOD2 enzyme) had an attenuated response to rosuvastatin compared to A-allele carriers, with less intense effects on inflammatory and fibrinolytic biomarkers.
population_specificity: 122 hypercholesterolemic patients undergoing their first pharmacological cholesterol-lowering therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of ezetimibe coadministration with peg-IFN/RBV on early virological and biochemical responses, including normalization of alanine aminotransferase, in nonobese and obese patients with chronic hepatitis C genotype 4.
results_summary: The study found that ezetimibe improved early virological response in obese patients and significantly enhanced biochemical responses (normalization of alanine aminotransferase) in both nonobese and obese patients compared to controls.
population_specificity: Nonobese and obese Egyptian patients with chronic hepatitis C genotype 4.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine (ezetimibe dosage not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: 12 weeks of ezetimibe plus peg-IFN/RBV, followed by 12 weeks of peg-IFN/RBV alone.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze changes in liver function, including s-alanine transaminase (ALAT), in patients with non-resectable hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) after stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT).
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in s-ALAT levels over the study period, though s-albumin decreased significantly at three months post-SBRT, indicating minor to moderate hepatic toxicity. No classic radiotherapy-induced liver disease (RILD) was observed, but two cases of non-classic RILD and grade 3 ascites were reported.
population_specificity: Twenty-six patients with non-resectable HCC (17 Child-Pugh class A, 9 Child-Pugh class B).
effective_dosage: Not specified (radiation doses ranged from 1.9-26 Gy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence on the coexistence of hepatitis B and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, focusing on challenges in clinical management, particularly regarding elevated Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the difficulty in determining the predominant cause of elevated ALT (chronic hepatitis B vs. NASH) and emphasizes the need for clinical judgment in managing these coexisting conditions. It reviews available evidence on frequency, differentiation methods, prognosis, treatment outcomes, and potential common pathways.
population_specificity: Patients with concomitant hepatitis B and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the seroprevalence of Hepatitis E virus (HEV) infection in Vietnamese patients with Hepatitis B virus (HBV)-related liver diseases and its potential impact on disease progression.
results_summary: The study found higher seroprevalences of anti-HEV IgG and IgM in HBV patients compared to healthy controls, with the highest rates in patients with liver cirrhosis. HEV superinfection was associated with abnormal liver function tests, suggesting it may influence HBV-related liver disease outcomes.
population_specificity: Vietnamese patients with HBV-related liver diseases (acute/chronic hepatitis B, liver cirrhosis, hepatocellular carcinoma) and healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of serum and plasma collected in polymeric gel tubes versus conventional tubes on metabolomics analysis, particularly focusing on amino acid metabolism including alanine.
results_summary: The study found that serum collected in polymeric gel tubes showed differences in amino acid metabolism, including alanine, compared to conventional tubes, while plasma showed no significant differences. These changes should be considered in experimental protocols for metabolomics analysis.
population_specificity: Not specified (general metabolomics research context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of bortezomib in multiple myeloma patients with hepatitis B, including monitoring alanine transaminase (ALT) levels and HBV DNA load.
results_summary: The study found that bortezomib did not significantly affect liver function (ALT levels) or HBV DNA load in HBV-infected multiple myeloma patients, suggesting it can be used safely in this population.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients in China with hepatitis B virus infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the real-world effectiveness and safety of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) in patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB), including its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: TDF demonstrated potent virologic and biochemical responses, with 77% of patients achieving normal alanine aminotransferase levels at 36 months. The treatment was well tolerated, including in pregnant women, with no marked changes in glomerular filtration rate.
population_specificity: Treatment-naïve and treatment-experienced patients with chronic hepatitis B in France, including those with comorbidities and elderly patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of weight-loss diets on changes in plasma alanine levels and its association with improved insulin resistance.
results_summary: The study found that reductions in alanine were significantly related to improved insulin resistance, independent of weight loss, in both trials. These improvements were statistically significant (P < 0.05).
population_specificity: Overweight or obese participants from two randomized dietary intervention trials (POUNDS LOST and DIRECT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine aminotransferase levels in identifying chronic HBV patients requiring treatment and assessing the efficacy of long-term nucleos(t)ide analogs in reducing complications like cirrhosis and HCC.
results_summary: The study found that persistently elevated alanine aminotransferase levels (>30 U/L for males, >19 U/L for females) combined with HBV DNA >2000 IU/mL indicate the need for treatment. Long-term nucleos(t)ide analogs effectively suppress HBV DNA, reduce fibrosis, reverse cirrhosis, and lower HCC risk with minimal resistance.
population_specificity: Chronic HBV patients, including those with cirrhosis and elevated alanine aminotransferase levels.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine aminotransferase; treatment dosages for nucleos(t)ide analogs (entecavir, tenofovir) not detailed.
study_duration: Long-term treatment (>6 years) noted for nucleos(t)ide analogs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether resveratrol alleviates non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) by examining its effects on liver injury markers, lipid content, and histological features.
results_summary: Resveratrol showed no significant improvement in liver injury markers (primary outcome: alanine transaminase) or histological features, but there was a small decrease in liver lipid content. No major metabolic improvements were observed, and one serious adverse event (fever and bicytopenia) was reported.
population_specificity: Overweight patients with transaminasemia and histological NAFLD (n=28, with 26 completing the trial).

study_goal: The researchers were examining the EU SmPC for teriflunomide, focusing on clinical and safety outcomes, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss Alanine's effects; it focuses on teriflunomide's efficacy and safety in MS patients.
population_specificity: Adult patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) or a first clinical demyelinating event.

study_goal: The researchers investigated the time of onset and characteristics of antituberculous drug-induced hepatotoxicity (ADIH), including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a risk factor.
results_summary: The study found that 10.5% of patients developed ADIH, with 70% occurring within the first month of treatment. Higher baseline ALT levels and hepatitis C virus presence were independent risk factors for ADIH.
population_specificity: Adult patients (n = 1,031) treated with first-line antituberculous drugs.
study_duration: Mean onset of ADIH was 39.6 ± 43.7 days after treatment initiation.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the SOL regimen (S-1, oxaliplatin, and leucovorin) in Chinese patients with metastatic colorectal cancer, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study did not focus on Alanine; it reported on the SOL regimen's efficacy and safety in mCRC patients, with no specific findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Chinese patients with untreated metastatic colorectal cancer.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine).
study_duration: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the safety and antiviral activity of PEG-CIFN (a recombinant interferon variant) in adults with HCV infection and assess its relationship with immune response markers.
results_summary: PEG-CIFN was well tolerated and effective at reducing HCV RNA levels, with higher doses (1.5 and 2.0 μg/kg) showing better early virologic responses. Immune markers like IP-10 and MIP-1β were associated with HCV RNA and liver enzyme levels.
population_specificity: 40 treatment-naive adults with hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.
effective_dosage: PEG-CIFN 1.0, 1.5, and 2.0 μg/kg, and peginterferon-α 180 μg, administered once weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess abnormal levels of liver aminotransferase (ALT and AST) in dengue patients as indicators of liver injury.
