results_summary: The study found elevated ALT and AST levels in dengue patients, with AST abnormality proportions of 0.80 in DHF and 0.75 in DF patients, and ALT abnormality proportions of 0.54 in DHF and 0.52 in DF patients, suggesting their utility in evaluating liver injury.
population_specificity: Dengue patients (both DF and DHF cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the effects of removing AST and ESR from a computerized laboratory test order form on their usage by general practitioners, with ALT (Alanine Transaminase) as a control test.
results_summary: The removal of AST and ESR from the order form reduced their use by up to 90%, while the use of control tests like ALT increased. The variation in the use of the removed tests also decreased.
population_specificity: General practitioners in primary care in Helsinki, Finland.
study_duration: Eight years (four years before and four years after the intervention)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the optimal management strategy for immunotolerant chronic HBV patients, including the role of monitoring alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and HBV DNA levels.
results_summary: The study found that immunotolerant HBV patients under 30 can be monitored with ALT and HBV DNA measurements, while those over 40 often require treatment. Liver biopsy or non-invasive fibrosis assessment may guide therapy for patients aged 30-40. Specific subgroups, such as immunosuppressed patients or pregnant women with high viraemia, often need anti-HBV treatment.
population_specificity: Immunotolerant patients with chronic HBV infection (HBeAg-positive, high viral replication, normal ALT, minimal liver damage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to differentiate the prognosis and management of inactive carriers (ICs) of HBV from HBeAg-negative chronic hepatitis patients, focusing on serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels and HBV DNA measurements.
results_summary: The study found that ICs, characterized by persistently normal ALT and low HBV DNA levels, have minimal liver damage and a favorable prognosis without antiviral treatment, though they require monitoring for HBV reactivation during immunosuppressive therapy. Spontaneous HBsAg loss occurs at a rate of 1-1.9% per year, and HCC development is rare in Caucasian ICs.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic HBV infection lacking HBeAg and with anti-HBe antibodies, specifically inactive carriers (ICs).
study_duration: Monitoring recommended every 12 months after diagnosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Ropren®, a biopolymer containing polyprenols, in improving liver function and reducing fibrosis in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
results_summary: Ropren® treatment led to significant improvements in blood lipids, clinical and biochemical signs, and reduced liver fibrosis index after 12 weeks, with no observed side effects.
population_specificity: 20 females aged 38-56 years with chronic NASH unresponsive to standard treatment.
effective_dosage: 54 mg/day, administered orally three times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a diagnostic algorithm (Doylestown algorithm) incorporating alanine aminotransferase levels, among other factors, to improve early detection of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in at-risk patients.
results_summary: The Doylestown algorithm, which includes alanine aminotransferase levels, improved HCC detection by 4% to 20% compared to AFP alone in external validation, with a 2% to 20% improvement at 95% specificity.
population_specificity: Patients with liver disease (cirrhosis) or HCC in the background of cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the optimal dose of atorvastatin for preventing contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) after carotid artery stenting (CAS), with a focus on monitoring alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a safety marker.
results_summary: High-dose atorvastatin (60 mg) significantly reduced CIN incidence (0%) compared to lower doses, but it also caused significant increases in alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, indicating potential liver stress. Pretreatment with 40 mg atorvastatin was deemed both effective and safe for preventing CIN.
population_specificity: 76 patients receiving selective carotid artery stenting (CAS).
effective_dosage: Low dose (20 mg), intermediate dose (40 mg), high dose (60 mg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of non-invasive models, including those involving alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in predicting fibrosis stages in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The study found that FibroMeter NAFLD and fibrosis 4 models, which incorporate alanine aminotransferase (ALT) data, showed significant accuracy in predicting fibrosis stages (F ≥ 1 and F ≥ 3) compared to other models. FibroMeter NAFLD had the highest specificity at fixed sensitivity, while fibrosis 4 outperformed others at fixed specificity.
population_specificity: Patients with biopsy-proven non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers compared the safety and efficacy of balloon-occluded trans-catheter arterial chemoembolization (B-TACE) versus conventional TACE (C-TACE) in treating hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), with a focus on lipiodol emulsion accumulation and adverse events, including alanine aminotransferase elevation.
results_summary: The study found that B-TACE resulted in a higher frequency of elevated alanine aminotransferase compared to C-TACE, with a statistically significant difference. Severe adverse events (liver abscess and infarction) occurred in B-TACE patients with bile duct dilatation, but the incidence did not differ significantly between groups.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) (50 cases in B-TACE group, 50 cases in C-TACE group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of alectinib in patients with ALK-positive NSCLC who had progressed on previous crizotinib treatment.
results_summary: Alectinib showed a 48% objective response rate in patients with measurable disease, with predominantly grade 1 or 2 adverse events, including constipation, fatigue, myalgia, and peripheral edema. The most common grade 3 and 4 adverse events were laboratory value changes, such as increased blood creatine phosphokinase and alanine aminotransferase.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18 years or older with stage IIIB-IV, ALK-positive NSCLC who had progressed after crizotinib treatment.
study_duration: Until progression, death, or withdrawal (median follow-up 4.8 months)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the natural history, pathogenetic mechanisms, and therapeutic options of chronic hepatitis B (CHB) with severe acute exacerbation, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a biomarker.
results_summary: The study found that an upsurge in serum HBV DNA often precedes elevated ALT levels during acute exacerbations of CHB, and early treatment with nucleos(t)ide analogues may improve outcomes, though no direct comparison of different analogues was available.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection experiencing severe acute exacerbations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term efficacy of PEG-IFN alfa-2a therapy in Japanese patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB), focusing on alanine transferase (ALT) normalization, HBeAg clearance, and low HBV DNA levels.
results_summary: The study found that 21% of HBeAg-positive patients and 25% of HBeAg-negative patients achieved sustained responses (ALT normalization, HBeAg clearance, and low HBV DNA) 5 years post-treatment. Response rates were higher in patients treated for 48 weeks compared to 24 weeks.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with chronic hepatitis B (17 HBeAg-positive, 5 HBeAg-negative).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of epoetin beta (EPO) on sustained virological response (SVR) in HCV-infected patients treated with peginterferon-ribavirin, focusing on factors like IFNL3/IFNL4 polymorphisms and AST/ALT ratio.
results_summary: The study found that EPO had little impact on SVR rates (57.4% in EPO group vs. 52.4% in control group), with no statistically significant difference. Independent factors associated with SVR included IFNL3/IFNL4 polymorphisms, HCV RNA level, iron level, and AST/ALT ratio.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive, genotype non-2/non-3 HCV-infected patients (n=227).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of peri-operative immunonutrition (including alanine-related compounds like glutamine) on clinical outcomes and liver function in liver transplant patients.
results_summary: Peri-operative immunonutrition reduced infectious complications and hospital stay but did not significantly affect serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels. No differences were found in mortality or rejection reactions.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing liver transplantation (501 participants across 7 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peripheral blood transcriptome signatures (PBTS) could distinguish individuals with acetaminophen-induced increases in serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels from nonresponders and placebos.
results_summary: The study found that PBTS of 707 and 760 genes could distinguish responders (30% of subjects with elevated ALT) and nonresponders from placebos. Responders showed increased expression of genes linked to TH2-mediated and innate immune responses, while nonresponders exhibited gene expression consistent with a tolerogenic immune response.
population_specificity: 42 adults (11 placebo, 31 treated with acetaminophen).
study_duration: 7 days of treatment, followed by 3 days of placebo.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the frequency of adverse reactions with a modified 2-phase acetylcysteine infusion protocol for paracetamol poisoning, including effects on alanine transaminase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that 35% of admissions experienced adverse reactions, with gastrointestinal symptoms being the most common. ALT levels > 1000 U/L were observed in 16 patients, mostly when treatment started >12 hours post-ingestion.
population_specificity: Patients with paracetamol poisoning (654 cases, median age 29, 453 females, 576 acute and 78 staggered/chronic ingestions).
effective_dosage: First infusion: 200 mg/kg over 4-9 h; second infusion: 100 mg/kg over 16 h.
study_duration: Variable, based on ingestion time (4-9 h for first infusion, 16 h for second).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between dietary alanine intake and blood pressure levels in a cross-cultural population.
results_summary: The study found a direct association between alanine intake (from animal sources) and higher blood pressure, suggesting it may negatively impact cardiovascular health in the studied population.
population_specificity: 4,680 men and women aged 40-59 years from Japan, China, the UK, and the US.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility, safety, and deep molecular response of combining nilotinib with peginterferon alfa-2a in newly diagnosed chronic-phase chronic myeloid leukaemia patients, not specifically focusing on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that 17% of patients achieved MR(4·5) at 12 months, with frequent hematological and hepatic adverse events, but most patients remained on interferon therapy for over a year.
population_specificity: Adult patients (age ≥18 years) with BCR-ABL-positive, chronic-phase chronic myeloid leukaemia at diagnosis.
effective_dosage: Peginterferon alfa-2a 45 μg per week combined with nilotinib 600 mg daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of eltrombopag (not Alanine) in children with persistent or chronic immune thrombocytopenia.
results_summary: The study found that 62% of patients receiving eltrombopag achieved the primary endpoint of platelet count ≥50 × 10⁹/L at least once without rescue therapy, compared to 32% in the placebo group. Adverse events were generally mild, with headache, upper respiratory tract infection, and diarrhea being the most common, and no thrombotic events or malignancies were reported.
population_specificity: Children aged 1-17 years with persistent or chronic immune thrombocytopenia and platelets <30 × 10⁹/L who had received at least one previous treatment.
effective_dosage: Varies by age and weight: 12-17 years (37.5 mg/day), 6-11 years (25-50 mg/day), 1-5 years (0.7-1.5 mg/kg/day, max 2 mg/kg).
study_duration: 7 weeks (randomized phase), with an optional open-label phase of up to 24 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of the all-oral combination of daclatasvir (DCV) plus asunaprevir (ASV) in patients with genotype 1b HCV infection, with or without compensated cirrhosis.
results_summary: The study found that DCV+ASV achieved high sustained virological response (SVR12) rates (84-91%) in both cirrhotic and non-cirrhotic patients, with a low frequency of serious adverse events (<10%) and no association between alanine aminotransferase elevations and hepatic decompensation.
population_specificity: Patients with genotype 1b HCV infection, with or without compensated cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of PDKs in cancer metabolism and the potential of targeting PDKs (and related metabolites like alanine) as a therapeutic strategy for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study suggests that PDKs, which regulate metabolites like alanine, are overexpressed in cancer cells and contribute to altered metabolic pathways. Inhibiting PDKs could rectify oxygen balance and induce cancer cell death, presenting a promising therapeutic approach.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro or theoretical context, not specified in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of LY2409021, a glucagon receptor antagonist, in lowering glucose and HbA1c levels in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: LY2409021 significantly reduced HbA1c and glucose levels over 12 and 24 weeks compared to placebo, with modest, reversible increases in serum aminotransferases and no statistically significant difference in hypoglycemia incidence.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes.
effective_dosage: 10, 30, or 60 mg once daily (Phase 2a); 2.5, 10, or 20 mg once daily (Phase 2b).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate therapeutic approaches, including Bio-11006 (which inhibits myristoylated alanine-rich C-kinase substrate), for reducing airway mucus in asthma and COPD.
results_summary: The abstract highlights Bio-11006 as a potential therapy for reducing mucus secretion, currently in Phase IIb trials, but notes that other inhibitors like EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitors have suboptimal efficacy and safety profiles.
population_specificity: Patients with asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

study_goal: The researchers compared the diagnostic performance of transient elastography (TE) and magnetic resonance elastography (MRE) for liver fibrosis, and TE-based CAP measurements versus MRI-based PDFF for hepatic steatosis in NAFLD patients, including the role of serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that MRE and PDFF methods outperformed TE and CAP in detecting liver fibrosis and steatosis, respectively. Serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) did not add diagnostic value for identifying nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
population_specificity: 142 patients with NAFLD (identified by liver biopsy; mean BMI 28.1 kg/m²) and 10 controls without NAFLD in Japan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of entecavir and tenofovir in nucleos(t)ide-naive chronic hepatitis B patients with hepatosteatosis over 48 weeks of therapy.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference between tenofovir and entecavir in achieving HBV-DNA negativity and alanine transferase normalization in patients with chronic hepatitis B and hepatosteatosis after 48 weeks. Both treatments were similarly effective.
population_specificity: Nucleos(t)ide-naive chronic hepatitis B patients with hepatosteatosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a multi-strain microbial cell preparation (probiotic) on renal profile and liver function tests, including Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), among type 2 diabetic individuals.
results_summary: The study found that 12 weeks of probiotic supplementation significantly reduced urea levels but did not significantly alter other renal or liver function parameters, including ALT.
population_specificity: Type 2 diabetic individuals aged 30-70 years in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the pharmacokinetics and safety of a personalized docetaxel dosage regimen in cancer patients with varying degrees of liver dysfunction, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a marker for hepatic dysfunction.
results_summary: The study found that docetaxel clearance significantly differed based on liver dysfunction categories, with reduced clearance in patients with mild and moderate dysfunction. However, docetaxel exposure and neutropenia incidence did not significantly vary between categories.
population_specificity: Cancer patients with varying degrees of liver dysfunction (normal, mild, or moderate based on ALT, AST, alkaline phosphatase, and bilirubin levels).
effective_dosage: Category 1 (normal): 40 mg/m²; Category 2 (mild): 30 mg/m²; Category 3 (moderate): 20 mg/m², administered weekly.
study_duration: Pharmacokinetics evaluated on day 1 and 8 of the first treatment cycle; adverse events monitored weekly for two treatment cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical significance of fecal HBV DNA and serum HBV DNA in patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) and their associations with liver function and intestinal microbiota.
results_summary: Fecal HBV DNA was positively correlated with serum HBV DNA and Enterococcus concentrations, while serum HBV DNA was negatively correlated with ALT, AST, and Lactobacillus levels. The study suggests fecal and serum HBV DNA have different effects in CHB patients.
population_specificity: 66 patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the association between liver function parameters, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) resistance in patients with Kawasaki disease.
results_summary: The study found that higher serum levels of ALT were significantly associated with IVIG resistance in Kawasaki disease patients, indicating a potential prognostic role for liver function markers. The results were statistically significant but showed heterogeneity, which was reduced when stratified by region.
population_specificity: Patients with Kawasaki disease (both IVIG-responsive and IVIG-resistant groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of continued entecavir (ETV) monotherapy versus alternative therapies (higher ETV dose or ETV/tenofovir combination) in achieving complete viral suppression and ALT normalization in partial responders to ETV.
results_summary: The study found that the ETV/tenofovir combination therapy achieved superior viral suppression and ALT normalization compared to continued ETV monotherapy at 0.5 mg or 1.0 mg doses. Patients on ETV/tenofovir had higher rates of complete viral suppression and ALT normalization at 6, 12, and 18 months post-switch.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive chronic hepatitis B patients who were partial responders to ETV (detectable HBV DNA after ≥12 months on ETV), predominantly Asian males who were hepatitis B e antigen-positive.
effective_dosage: ETV 0.5 mg daily, ETV 1.0 mg daily, or ETV 0.5 mg/tenofovir 300 mg daily.
study_duration: Variable, with follow-up periods up to 18 months post-switch.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and efficacy of lapatinib combined with different cytotoxic drugs (capecitabine, vinorelbine, or gemcitabine) in HER2(+) metastatic breast cancer patients after taxane failure, not specifically studying alanine.
results_summary: The study found increased alanine aminotransferase/aspartate aminotransferase (4% in LC arm, 13% in LG arm) as adverse events, but did not focus on alanine's effects.
population_specificity: HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer patients with progression after taxane treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of corticosteroid therapy in improving clinical outcomes, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, in patients with HELLP syndrome.
results_summary: Corticosteroid treatment significantly improved ALT levels (MD: -143.34 IU/L; p=0.04) and other markers like platelet count and LDH, but did not significantly affect maternal mortality or overall morbidity.
population_specificity: Pregnant patients diagnosed with HELLP syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of nucleotide/nucleoside analog (NA) monotherapy, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, for treating hepatitis B virus-associated glomerulonephritis (HBV-GN).
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in proteinuria remission, HBV-DNA negative conversion, HBeAg clearance, and ALT levels with NA monotherapy. It also suggested potential renal function protection by preventing serum creatinine elevation.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatitis B virus-associated glomerulonephritis (HBV-GN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare liver function and long-term prognosis in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) who achieved sustained virological response (SVR) to interferon therapy versus those who did not.
results_summary: Patients with SVR had better-preserved liver function and significantly higher overall and recurrence-free survival rates compared to non-SVR and no-interferon groups. Early detection of HCC post-SVR and careful surgical intervention were highlighted as important for favorable outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C who underwent hepatic resection for HCC in Japan.
study_duration: Mean time from SVR to hepatectomy was 6.2 years (range: 2 months to 20 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate laboratory changes, including alanine aminotransferase levels, during isotretinoin therapy for acne using meta-analytic methods.
results_summary: The study found that isotretinoin therapy was associated with a mean alanine aminotransferase level of 21.77 U/L (18.96-24.59 U/L), indicating minimal hepatic impact, and overall laboratory abnormalities were low.
population_specificity: Patients aged 9 to 35 years with acne vulgaris.
effective_dosage: Isotretinoin doses of 40 mg/d or more.

study_goal: The researchers were not attempting to determine anything about Alanine; the study focused on quercetin's safety and antiviral activity in hepatitis C patients.
results_summary: The study did not report any findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic HCV infection

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine if birth-cohort testing for HCV antibody positivity identified patients with fewer documented risk factors or medical indications (including elevated alanine transaminase levels) compared to a risk-based testing strategy.
results_summary: The study found that birth-cohort testing identified HCV antibody-positive patients who were significantly less likely to have elevated alanine transaminase levels (>40 U/L) or other risk-associated factors compared to risk-based testing.
population_specificity: Patients identified as HCV antibody-positive in the baseline (risk-based) and birth-cohort testing phases of the Hepatitis C Assessment and Testing (HepCAT) Project.

study_goal: The study examined the effects of intensive versus less intensive statin therapy on renal function, safety, and laboratory parameters, including serum uric acid, in elderly coronary artery disease patients with or without chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: Elevated serum alanine transaminase (>3 times the upper limit of normal) occurred in 4.4% of atorvastatin-treated patients and 0.2% of pravastatin-treated patients. The study did not focus on alanine's effects but noted its elevation as a side effect of statin therapy.
population_specificity: Elderly coronary artery disease patients (65-85 years) with or without chronic kidney disease.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on statins, not alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate a liver fibrosis assessment program using transient elastography (TE) in different clinical settings, including the role of alanine transferase levels in predicting severe fibrosis.
results_summary: The study found that increased alanine transferase levels were independently associated with severe liver fibrosis (F3-F4, F4), particularly in regional settings and among people who use drugs (PWUD).
population_specificity: Patients referred for liver fibrosis assessment in tertiary hospitals, community clinics, PWUD clinics, and regional clinics in rural Victoria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Hypothermic Oxygenated PErfusion (HOPE) treatment could improve graft quality and outcomes in donation after cardiac death (DCD) liver grafts compared to static cold preservation.
results_summary: HOPE treatment significantly reduced graft injury, intrahepatic cholangiopathy, biliary complications, and improved 1-year graft survival in DCD livers compared to cold-stored DCD livers, achieving results similar to brain-dead donor livers.
population_specificity: Donation after cardiac death (DCD) liver graft recipients and brain-dead donor liver graft recipients.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the antitumor activity of dasatinib in adenoid cystic carcinoma (ACC) and non-ACC malignant salivary gland tumors (MSGT), not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study reported increased alanine aminotransferase levels in 7% of patients as an adverse event, but no specific effects or outcomes related to Alanine were discussed.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive, recurrent/metastatic ACC (+cKIT) and non-ACC MSGT.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on dasatinib, not Alanine).
study_duration: Response assessed every 8 weeks; median progression-free survival was 4.8 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of pyronaridine-artesunate after first treatment versus re-treatment of malaria episodes, with a focus on hepatotoxicity markers like alanine aminotransferase.
results_summary: The study found similar safety profiles for pyronaridine-artesunate in first treatment and re-treatment, with low hepatotoxicity incidence (1%). Efficacy was high, with day 28 ACPR at 92.7% for pyronaridine-artesunate versus 80.4% for artemether-lumefantrine.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥6 months with uncomplicated Plasmodium spp malaria in Mali, Burkina Faso, and Guinea.
study_duration: Follow-up at day 28 and day 42 post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of an all-oral regimen (daclatasvir and asunaprevir) with IFN-based treatments (telaprevir or simeprevir plus PEG-IFN/RBV) in preventing hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), while measuring alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and α-fetoprotein (AFP) levels as suppressive markers.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in sustained virological response (SVR) or changes in serum ALT, AFP, or platelet count among the three treatment groups, suggesting comparable efficacy between the IFN-free and IFN-based regimens in HCC prevention.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatitis C (n = 57 total: 17 on daclatasvir and asunaprevir, 15 on simeprevir plus PEG-IFN/RBV, 25 on telaprevir plus PEG-IFN/RBV).
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine (ALT was measured, not administered).
study_duration: 24 weeks for daclatasvir and asunaprevir; 12 weeks for telaprevir/simeprevir plus 24 weeks of PEG-IFN/RBV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare glycaemic control and quality of life between continuous intraperitoneal insulin infusion (CIPII) and subcutaneous (SC) insulin therapy in type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM) patients, with a secondary focus on biochemical measurements including alanine aminotransferase.
results_summary: The study found a 3.6 U/l lower concentration of alanine aminotransferase in CIPII-treated patients compared to SC insulin therapy, but no other biochemical or clinical differences were observed.
population_specificity: Patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus (CIPII n = 39, SC n = 144).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of topical E6005 ointment in healthy volunteers and patients with atopic dermatitis, including monitoring alanine aminotransferase levels as part of safety evaluation.
results_summary: The study found that E6005 ointment had acceptable safety and tolerability, with minimal systemic exposure. Adverse events included increased alanine aminotransferase in one healthy volunteer, leading to discontinuation.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers and patients with atopic dermatitis.
effective_dosage: 0.01% to 0.2% E6005 ointment (concentration not specified for alanine-related outcomes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of antiviral therapy, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase normalization, in children with chronic HBV infection.
results_summary: Antiviral therapy improved alanine aminotransferase normalization, HBV DNA suppression, and HBeAg seroconversion in children with chronic HBV infection, particularly in studies with shorter follow-up periods (<12 months). However, it did not significantly reduce the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma or cirrhosis.
population_specificity: Children (<18 years) with chronic HBV infection.
study_duration: Varied, with follow-up periods ranging from <12 months to ≥12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate anxiety and depression in patients with acute hepatitis C, including the correlation with alanine aminotransferase levels as a marker of disease severity.
results_summary: The study found no correlation between anxiety or depression scores (HADS-A or HADS-D) and alanine aminotransferase levels, indicating that these symptoms were unrelated to the severity of liver disease. Antiviral therapy did not significantly alter anxiety levels but showed a trend toward increased depression scores by the end of treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with acute hepatitis C infection enrolled in the German Hep-Net Acute HCV-III study.
study_duration: Duration of antiviral therapy not explicitly stated, but data were collected at baseline, end of treatment, and end of study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of CD4CXCR5ICOSPD1 Tfh cells in infectious mononucleosis (IM) and their association with alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that CD4CXCR5ICOSPD1 Tfh cells were significantly increased in IM patients, correlated with EBV DNA load, and were associated with ALT levels, suggesting a potential role in IM pathogenesis.
population_specificity: Patients with infectious mononucleosis (IM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether gut metabolic alterations, including alanine levels, were associated with the development of eczema in infants.
results_summary: Lower amounts of alanine were found in fecal samples of children who later developed eczema compared to those who did not. The study suggests a potential link between alanine levels and eczema development, though causality was not established.
population_specificity: 3-month-old infants at risk of developing eczema.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine (probiotic dosage not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: Probiotic supplementation until 3 months of age (follow-up until 1 year).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between circulating cytokines and histological liver damage in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients, particularly those with normal or mildly elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and to assess the utility of cytokines in diagnosing liver inflammation and fibrosis.
results_summary: The study found that CXCL-11 was independently associated with moderate inflammation, while IL-2R and TGF-α were independent indicators of significant fibrosis in CHB patients, including those with normal or mildly elevated ALT. A cytokine-based score (fib-index) outperformed existing diagnostic tools for fibrosis.
population_specificity: 227 CHB patients, including those with ALT less than 2 times the upper limit of normal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential benefits of metreleptin, including its effects on metabolic abnormalities such as elevated alanine transaminase, in patients with non-HIV associated lipodystrophy.
results_summary: Metreleptin treatment improved metabolic abnormalities, including elevated alanine transaminase, in patients with generalized lipodystrophy and showed potential benefits for partial lipodystrophy. The treatment also corrected hyperphagia linked to leptin deficiency.
population_specificity: Patients with generalized or partial non-HIV associated lipodystrophy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current clinical guidelines for managing chronic hepatitis B (CHB), including the role of monitoring serum alanine aminotransferase concentrations in treatment decisions.
results_summary: The study highlights that elevated serum alanine aminotransferase levels, alongside HBV DNA, are key indicators for initiating antiviral therapy in CHB patients, improving clinical outcomes. Monitoring these markers helps assess treatment efficacy and disease progression.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) at high risk of liver-related morbidity.

study_goal: The study aimed to disclose the epidemiological and clinical characteristics of SFTSV infection in China, including clinical manifestations and laboratory findings.
results_summary: Elevated alanine transaminase was noted as a major laboratory finding in SFTSV infection, but the study did not focus on alanine's effects or safety. The mortality rate was about 1.9 parts per million, with older age and delayed hospitalization associated with fatal outcomes.
population_specificity: 1920 SFTS patients and 19,119 healthy subjects in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the association between conjugated linoleic acid (CLA) consumption (supplementation or enriched foods) and serum liver enzyme levels, including alanine transaminase (ALT), in healthy adults.
results_summary: CLA supplementation nonsignificantly increased ALT levels but had no significant effect on alkaline phosphatase (ALP). CLA significantly increased aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels, though enriched foods did not.
population_specificity: Healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ledipasvir/sofosbuvir in black patients with genotype 1 HCV infection, comparing outcomes to non-black patients.
results_summary: The study found that 95% of black patients and 97% of non-black patients achieved sustained virologic response at 12 weeks (SVR12). Adverse events were more common in ribavirin-containing arms, but no significant safety differences were observed by race.
population_specificity: Black and non-black patients with genotype 1 HCV infection, including treatment-naïve and treatment-experienced individuals, some with compensated cirrhosis.
effective_dosage: Once-daily ledipasvir/sofosbuvir, with or without ribavirin (specific dosages not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the tolerability and tumor response of pemetrexed-cisplatin chemotherapy followed by gefitinib maintenance therapy versus gefitinib monotherapy in Korean patients with non-small cell lung cancer, focusing on EGFR status.
results_summary: Elevated alanine aminotransferase was noted as a frequent adverse event in the gefitinib arm, but the study primarily focused on treatment tolerability and tumor response rather than alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Korean patients ≥18 years, chemonaïve, light ex-smokers/never-smokers with advanced NSCLC.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the prevalence of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in children and adolescents and assess variations by factors like BMI, gender, and diagnostic method, including the role of elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that NAFLD prevalence was higher in obese children (34.2%) compared to the general population (7.6%), with males and higher BMI categories showing increased prevalence. Elevated ALT was less sensitive for detecting NAFLD compared to biopsies, ultrasound, or MRI.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 1-19 years, including general population and obesity clinic attendees.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and potential therapeutic value of Puquitinib Mesylate (XC-302), focusing on adverse events including alanine transaminase (ALT) elevations in patients with relapsed or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
results_summary: The study found that ALT elevations were common (14 of 21 patients), with dose-limiting toxicities observed at higher doses (50 mg). The overall response rate was low (2 of 19), and median progression-free survival was short (1.9 months).
population_specificity: Patients with relapsed or refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (21 participants).
effective_dosage: 25 mg, 37.5 mg, or 50 mg twice daily.
study_duration: Median of 2 cycles (28-day cycles), maximum of 20 cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical outcomes, liver function markers (including alanine aminotransferase, ALT), and prognoses in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients superinfected with other hepatitis viruses.
results_summary: The study found that CHB patients superinfected with HCV, HDV, or HEV had worse clinical outcomes, including higher ALT levels, compared to monoinfected CHB patients, while HAV superinfection generally resulted in better outcomes.
population_specificity: 211 patients with confirmed chronic hepatitis B (CHB) in a tertiary teaching hospital in China (2005–2014).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the correlation between alcohol biomarkers (including alanine aminotransferase) and self-reported alcohol consumption in alcohol-dependent patients.
results_summary: The study found that PEth and CDT showed better correlation with diary-based alcohol consumption than retrospective data, with PEth being the most sensitive biomarker. Alanine aminotransferase was included as a biomarker but its specific correlation results were not highlighted in the abstract.
population_specificity: 160 alcohol-dependent patients (115 completers: 76 men, 39 women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) and S-adenosylmethionine (SAMe) monotherapy versus their combined effect on intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy (ICP), including the impact on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: All therapies significantly improved pruritus and reduced serum levels of total bile acids, ALT, AST, and total bilirubin. UDCA monotherapy was more effective than SAMe in reducing bile acids and showed better outcomes in AST and bilirubin reduction compared to SAMe alone.
population_specificity: Singleton pregnancies with intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy (ICP) in five tertiary medical centers.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine; UDCA (4×250 mg daily), SAMe (1000 mg daily).

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the efficacy, safety, and pharmacokinetics of pilaralisib or voxtalisib in combination with letrozole for HR+, HER2-negative, recurrent or metastatic breast cancer, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found limited efficacy with pilaralisib or voxtalisib combined with letrozole, with one partial response in the pilaralisib arm. Adverse events included increased alanine aminotransferase (11%) in the voxtalisib arm, but Alanine itself was not the focus.
population_specificity: Patients with hormone-receptor-positive, HER2-negative, non-steroidal aromatase inhibitor-refractory, recurrent or metastatic breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare and contrast the pharmacology, mechanisms of action, spectrum of activity, safety profiles, and clinical efficacy of two new lipoglycopeptides (oritavancin and dalbavancin) against MRSA and other gram-positive infections.
results_summary: The study found that the new lipoglycopeptides have prolonged half-lives and increased potency against MRSA compared to vancomycin, with unique dosing profiles due to their lipophilic tails. Clinical trials evaluating their use were reviewed, but specific results regarding Alanine were not mentioned.
population_specificity: Patients with acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections, particularly those caused by MRSA and other gram-positive organisms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of plasma exchange (PE) on chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients with acute-on-chronic liver failure (ACLF) treated with entecavir (ETV).
results_summary: PE significantly improved short-term survival in CHB patients with ACLF treated with ETV, with higher cumulative survival rates at weeks 4 and 12 compared to the control group. While bilirubin levels decreased more quickly in the PE group, ALT levels and virological responses were similar between groups.
population_specificity: CHB-naïve patients with hepatic decompensation and ACLF.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of UDCA and bezafibrate combination therapy in treating primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC), including its effects on liver biochemistry, such as alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that combination therapy significantly reduced serum alanine aminotransferase levels (MD, -10.24 IU/L; P<0.00001), indicating improved liver biochemistry, but did not improve clinical symptoms or mortality rates. Adverse events were more frequent with combination therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC) (269 participants across 9 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the limitations of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a biomarker for drug-induced liver injury (DILI) and explore the potential of HMGB1 isoforms as more sensitive biomarkers.
results_summary: The study found that HMGB1 isoforms outperform ALT in predicting DILI development and liver transplant necessity following acetaminophen overdose, but current diagnostic assays for HMGB1 are either time-consuming or unable to distinguish between redox and acetyl isoforms.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on biomarker comparison rather than a specific study population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify markers of severe leptospirosis, including elevated alanine transaminase (ALT) levels, in a cohort of Sri Lankan patients.
results_summary: Elevated ALT (>70 IU/L) was significantly associated with severe leptospirosis (OR 2.639, p=0.044), indicating its potential as a biomarker for disease severity. The study did not assess alanine's therapeutic effects but highlighted its diagnostic relevance.
population_specificity: 232 patients with serologically confirmed leptospirosis in Sri Lanka.

study_goal: The abstract does not address any research goals related to Alanine.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: The study population is a 58-year-old female with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and hepatitis C-related cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of idelalisib combined with rituximab as initial therapy for older patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic leukemia, including its impact on alanine transaminase/aspartate transaminase levels.
results_summary: The study found that the combination therapy was highly active, with an overall response rate of 97%, but elevated alanine transaminase/aspartate transaminase levels occurred in 67% of patients (23% grade ≥3). Progression-free survival was 83% at 36 months, indicating durable disease control.
population_specificity: Treatment-naïve older patients with CLL or small lymphocytic leukemia (median age 71 years, range 65-90).
effective_dosage: Idelalisib 150 mg twice daily continuously for 48 weeks; rituximab 375 mg/m² weekly ×8.
study_duration: Median time on treatment was 22.4 months (range 0.8-45.8+).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term effects of two fixed-dose combinations (candesartan/amlodipine and olmesartan/azelnidipine) on laboratory parameters, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients with hypertension.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in the mean changes of laboratory parameters, including alanine aminotransferase, between the two treatment groups. Both combinations showed similar effects on renal function over 1 year.
population_specificity: Patients in routine clinical practice (n=182 per group, propensity-score matched).
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine aminotransferase specifically; study drugs were candesartan/amlodipine (8/5 mg/day) and olmesartan/azelnidipine (20/16 mg/day).

study_goal: To determine if alanine aminotransferase levels predict cardiovascular events in people with Type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Higher alanine aminotransferase levels were inversely associated with cardiovascular event risk, suggesting low levels may indicate hepatic or systemic frailty. No relationship was found for gamma-glutamyltransferase.
population_specificity: People with Type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the safety and efficacy of a neoadjuvant therapy combination (gemcitabine, docetaxel, and pazopanib) for high-grade extremity soft tissue sarcomas, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found significant toxicity with the GDP combination, leading to treatment discontinuation in some patients. No objective responses were observed, though one patient had a ≥90% pathologic response.
population_specificity: Patients with high-grade, extremity soft tissue sarcomas >8 cm amenable to definitive resection.
effective_dosage: 900 mg/m² gemcitabine (days 1 and 8), 75 mg/m² docetaxel (day 8), and 400 mg pazopanib daily.
interactions: Concomitant pazopanib may increase docetaxel exposure, contributing to toxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between transaminases (including alanine transaminase, ALT) and myocardial damage in STEMI patients, as well as their prognostic value for major adverse cardiac events (MACE).
results_summary: Peak ALT levels were significantly associated with worse cardiac outcomes, including reduced ejection fraction, larger infarct size, microvascular obstruction, and reduced MACE-free survival. High peak ALT was an independent predictor of MACE after adjusting for clinical risk factors.
population_specificity: 167 STEMI patients who underwent primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PPCI).
study_duration: Blood samples were taken from day 1 to day 4 after PPCI; follow-up lasted 2.7 [1.1-3.3] years.

study_goal: The study aimed to determine the recommended phase 2 dose of veliparib in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel and assess its pharmacokinetics, tolerability, and preliminary efficacy in Japanese patients with solid tumors.
results_summary: The study found that veliparib combined with carboplatin and paclitaxel had a manageable safety profile, with common adverse events including leukopenia, neutropenia, and increased alanine aminotransferase. Six partial responses were observed, suggesting potential efficacy.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with solid tumors, specifically non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
effective_dosage: Veliparib was administered at 40, 80, or 120 mg BID (twice daily).
study_duration: Patients received up to 6 cycles of 21-day treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether AMAP (a non-hepatotoxic analog of acetaminophen) is toxic to primary human hepatocytes and to explore the mechanism of toxicity.
results_summary: AMAP caused dose-dependent cell death, glutathione depletion, and mitochondrial damage in primary human hepatocytes but not in primary mouse hepatocytes. The toxicity in human cells involved mitochondrial protein adduct formation and dysfunction.
population_specificity: Primary human hepatocytes (PHH) and primary mouse hepatocytes (PMH).
